details.description:
Get a list of a group's issues.

#### Required permissions

- `View Issues (group.issues.read)`

parameters.description: A filter to select issues updated before this date.
parameters.name: updated_before

parameters.description: A filter to select issues updated after this date.
parameters.name: updated_after

parameters.description: A filter to select issues created before this date.
parameters.name: created_before

parameters.description: A filter to select issues created after this date.
parameters.name: created_after

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: The request was missing these required fields: ...

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

version.description: Version of the JSON API specification this server supports.

401.description: Unauthorized: the request requires an authentication token or a token with more permissions.

deprecation.description:
The deprecation date of the underlying endpoint. For more information, please refer to the deprecation header RFC:

snyk-version-lifecycle-stage.description: The version stage of the endpoint. This stage describes the guarantees snyk provides surrounding stability of the endpoint.

snyk-version-requested.description: The version of the endpoint requested by the caller.

snyk-version-served.description: The version of the endpoint that was served by the API.

sunset.description: A header containing the date of when the underlying endpoint will be removed. This header is only present if the endpoint has been deprecated. For information purposes only. Returned as a date in the format: YYYY-MM-DD
